Builders in a territory gain +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement.
Farm improvements with bonus resources provide +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food. +1 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron within the borders.
Pioneers gain +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [Icon_Governor] Governor title.
+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] production when building districts.
+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production towards the construction of buildings and wonders in the Holy Site.
Melee units gain +3 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength when attacked by cavalry units
Buildings in the Commercial Center produce +15% [ICON_GOLD] gold.
Lumber Mill Improvement +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
If the academy is adjacent to a mountain range, the building's science output [ICON_SCIENCE] is increased by 15%.
+15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when producing military units.
+100% [ICON_GREATMERCHANT] Great Merchant Points generated by the Commercial Center each round.
Allows diplomatic actions to research agreements. [ICON_TECHBOOSTED] Eureka provides an additional 10% technology progress.
Stairwell Improvements give +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. City Centers give +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenities, and +1 [ICON_HOUSING] Housing.

+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route Capacity. +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for cities with Stables and Banks. +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement for Army Melee Units, Army Ranged Units, Army Siege Units and Anti-Cavalry Units. +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement for Civilian Units.
Naval ranged units gain +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when attacking.
Ranged and siege units gain +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when attacking.
A properly powered Broadcast Center grants +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity to cities within 6 tiles. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
+1 [ICON_Movement] movement for water transport units.
Cities with a commercial center provide 15% more [ICON_GOLD] coins per turn

Recruits 1 additional spy. +100% [ICON_Tourism] tourism throughout the empire. Increases [ICON_SCIENCE] science produced by the city per turn by 15%. [NEWLINE]Rewards 2 [ICON_Governor] governor titles.
15% faster construction of districts and buildings, +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength for Heavy Cavalry units.
Each city with both a Broadcast Center and a Space Center can increase the Amenity of cities within its borders by +1 [ICON_AMENITIES]. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
Military units gain +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement.
Military units +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
Buildings in industrial areas gain +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity. All cities gain +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] amenity. Mines, quarries, and lumberyards gain +1 [ICON_Production] productivity.
+5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when defending a military unit
Air Force +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength

Unlocks the Doomsday Robot upgrade "Strong Armor": +10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength when defending against land and naval units. [NEWLINE] Damaged military units recover an additional 5 [ICON_DAMAGED] health points per turn. +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity for all cities.

Unlocks the Doomsday Robot upgrade "Increased Mobility": +3 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement. Can perform a single jump across mountainous terrain. [NEWLINE] Increases [ICON_SCIENCE] technology produced by the Research Lab by 15%

Reduces unit CO2 emissions by 50%. Unlocks the Doomsday Mech upgrade "Particle Beam Siege Cannon": +100% ranged attack efficiency and +30 ranged attack damage when attacking cities and military camps. [NEWLINE] +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] mobility for builders. +1 [ICON_AMENITIES] amenity and +5 [ICON_POWER] electricity for all cities. [NEWLINE] Rewards 2 [ICON_Governor] titles.

Unlocks the Doomsday Robot upgrade "Drone Air Defense": +100 [ICON_ANTIAIR_LARGE] Air Defense Combat Strength. Increases [ICON_PRODUCTION] productivity of factories per turn by 50%. Military units gain +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement, +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength
+1 [ICON_Production] Productivity for Quarry Improvements. +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity when constructing buildings. Can improve Terraced Farms on Hills.
Unlocks 1 [ICON_GOVERNOR] Governor title for Suleiman the Magnificent (Lawmaker).
Quarry Improvement +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Air Force +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength
Doubles the support and flanking bonuses of combat units. Your Corps and Armies gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.
Oil Wells and Oil Drilling Improvements +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
Rewards 1 [Icon_Governor] Governor title.
If [ICON_POWER] power supply is sufficient, the Broadcast Center can increase the [ICON_AMENITIES] amenity of cities within 6 blocks by 1.
Garrisoned units gain +3 [ICON_Strength] Defense and automatically gain a garrison bonus for two turns. Garrisoned defense increases after researching Fortress and Steel.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route capacity. Allows merchants to board ships and harvest [ICON_RESOURCE_FISH] fish and [ICON_RESOURCE_CRABS] crabs.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route Capacity. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold to Fishing Boat Improvement. All naval and marine units can sail on ocean tiles.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade Route Capacity. +2 [ICON_Movement] Movement Capacity for Water Transport Units.

Provides one level of diplomatic visibility to all other civilizations. Doubles all [ICON_Tourism] gains from [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] Great Works. +10% [ICON_Science], [ICON_Culture], [ICON_Gold], and [ICON_Faith] output from all civilization's cities. [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] title.
Can be completed multiple times, increasing Diplomatic Victory and Score Victory Points. Each time completed, all cities gain +5% [ICON_Production] Production when building city projects.
Allows felling of trees and mining of [ICON_RESOURCE_STONE] Stone and [ICON_RESOURCE_Copper] Copper.
Great Wall adjacency bonus includes [ICON_Culture] Culture bonus. If using Catherine de' Medici (Black Queen), you get 1 free Spy. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.

Gives [ICON_Tourism] bonus to all improvements that provide [ICON_Culture] culture. Output of [ICON_Tourism] equals the improvement's [ICON_Culture] culture output. [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] title.
For every library in the empire, all libraries provide an additional 0.5 [ICON_Science] technology. If a religion has been established, an additional +1 [ICON_GreatPROPHET] Great Prophet point.
Each [ICON_CITIZEN] citizen in a city of 8 or more provides 0.5 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science.

+10% Productivity and +10% Combat XP for all melee, anti-cavalry, and ranged land units trained in this city. If [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron is unlocked, 2 [ICON_RESOURCE_IRON] Iron is produced per turn. [NEWLINE] +5 Strategic Resource Reserves (at standard speed). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Cannot be built in a Barracks area that already has a Stable.

This city gives +10% productivity to all cavalry, and +10% combat experience. If [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] horses are unlocked, 2 [ICON_RESOURCE_HORSES] horses are produced each turn. [NEWLINE] +5 strategic resource reserves (at standard speed). [NEWLINE][NEWLINE] Cannot be built in a Barracks area that already has a Barracks.
+15% productivity for all non-siege land units trained in this city. [NEWLINE] +10 strategic resource reserves (at standard speed).

All land military units trained in this city will be promoted for free if they do not have free promotion at the beginning, and +20% combat experience. [NEWLINE] Strategic resource reserves +10 (at standard speed). [NEWLINE] Legions and armies can be trained directly. The training cost of legions and armies is reduced by 25%.
+1 [ICON_TradeRoute] Trade route capacity.
Provides an additional [ICON_Gold] gold equivalent to the commercial center adjacency bonus. [ICON_TradeRoute] foreign trade routes from this city +3 [ICON_Gold] gold

Ottoman unique building. Each different strategic resource improved in this city gives 1 additional point. Each luxury resource improved in this city gives 1 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenity. +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture to trade routes from this city. +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to international [ICON_TRADEROUTE] trade routes from this city for each strategic resource in this city.

+2 [ICON_Gold] gold for each improved luxury good in the empire, +5 [ICON_Gold] gold for each improved strategic resource. [NEWLINE]After unlocking computer technology, if [ICON_Power] is sufficient, the gold produced by buildings in the commercial district of this city will be increased by 10%.
City luxury resources +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold output.

Provides additional [ICON_Production] Production equal to the adjacency bonus of the Industrial Zone. Its [ICON_Production] Production bonus extends to all City Centers within 6 tiles (provided they don't already receive a bonus from another building of this type). If adjacent to a City Center, the city gains -1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. [NEWLINE]For each Factory in the country, foreign trade routes from the city with the Factory gain +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.

Unique Japanese building. Provides 0.5 [ICON_Production] productivity per population point. Its [ICON_Production] productivity bonus extends to all city centers within 6 tiles, and after researching "Electricity" technology, it provides +5 [ICON_Culture] culture to the surrounding 6 tiles (provided it does not already have a bonus from other buildings of this type). [NEWLINE]For each Electronics Factory in the country, foreign trade routes from cities with Electronics Factory will receive +3 [ICON_Gold] gold.

Provides +5 [ICON_Gold] to each city within 6 tiles (if they don't already have a bonus from another Coal Power Plant building). Automatically converts any amount of [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal into [ICON_Power] Electricity, providing the power needed by cities within 6 tiles per turn:[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 [ICON_RESOURCE_COAL] Coal [ICON_PowerRight] 4 [ICON_Power] Electricity[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Emits large amounts of Carbon Dioxide into the atmosphere.

Automatically converts any amount of [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] oil into [ICON_Power] electricity, providing the power needed by cities within 6 cells each turn:[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 point of [ICON_RESOURCE_OIL] oil [ICON_PowerRight] 6 points of [ICON_Power] electricity[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]Emits a moderate amount of carbon dioxide into the atmosphere

Automatically converts any amount of [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] Uranium into [ICON_Power] Electricity, providing +5 [ICON_Gold] and the power needed by cities within 9 tiles per turn:[NEWLINE][ICON_Bullet]1 [ICON_RESOURCE_URANIUM] Uranium [ICON_PowerRight]16 [ICON_Power] Electricity[NEWLINE]This extends its [ICON_Production] Production and [ICON_Science] Science bonuses to all City Centers within 6 tiles (provided they don't already have a bonus from another "Power Plant" building).
+1 [ICON_GOLD] gold to fishing boats in this city. If the city is adjacent to a coastal tile, +1 [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route capacity, and +2 [ICON_GOLD] gold to trade routes from this city.

[ICON_Production] Productivity bonus equal to the Port District's adjacency bonus. All Lumber Mills in this city provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity, and all improved Coast and Lake tiles provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity. Cities adjacent to Ocean tiles within 6 tiles build Naval units 20% faster.

Provides an additional [ICON_Gold] gold equal to the port district's adjacency bonus. If the city is adjacent to a coastal tile, it provides +2 [ICON_FOOD] food, +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] production, +6 [ICON_GOLD] gold, +2 [ICON_HOUSING] housing, and +6 [ICON_Tourism] tourism. [NEWLINE]Can directly produce fleets and armadas.

Gain an [ICON_Envoy] Envoy immediately upon completion. +2 Influence Points per Turn, +3 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor. Enemy Spies have their effectiveness reduced by one level when targeting this city or a city with a Barracks.

Upon completion, instantly gain an [ICON_Envoy] and an [Icon_Governor] title. +3 Influence Points per Turn. When this civilization captures or kills an enemy spy, gain 50 [ICON_Science] for each upgrade the enemy spy has.
Provides additional [ICON_Culture] Culture equal to the Theater Square adjacency bonus.

Cities within 6 tiles of a Zoo gain +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for each Unimproved Forest, Rainforest, Swamp, or Floodplain tile in the city (provided it does not already have a bonus from another "Zoo" building).[NEWLINE] Cities with a Zoo in each terrain type (Snow, Frozen, Desert, Plains, or Grasslands) gain +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism, and +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for Zoos.

After unlocking "Radio", if [ICON_Power] is sufficient, provide all City Centers within 6 tiles with the following 3 bonuses, +1 each: [ICON_Culture] Culture, [ICON_Gold] Gold Production, and [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. After unlocking "Satellite", the radiation range is expanded to 9 tiles and the radiation bonus is +1. (provided that it has not yet received a bonus from another "Stadium" building)

[ICON_Amenities] Amenity bonus extends to every City Center within 9 tiles. This bonus can only be applied once per city, so duplicate buildings within 9 tiles of a City Center will not provide additional bonuses. +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for each Coastal Resource in the radius, +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science for each Reef, +2 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism for each Shipwreck Site, +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture for each Shipwreck Site. (provided it has not yet received a bonus from another "Aquarium" building)

+3 [ICON_Gold] gold for foreign trade routes from this city, and 0.5 [ICON_GOLD] gold for each [ICON_CITIZEN] citizen of this city. +1 air unit slot for an airport, and -1 [ICON_Amenities] for an amenity slot if adjacent to a city center. After the Emergency Deployment civic is unlocked, land units can be airlifted between airports with airports.
+1 air unit slot in the airport area. +10 strategic resource reserves (at standard speed).
+2 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities, +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing for all cities. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
+8 Loyalty to all cities, +10% [ICON_Production] Production when producing military units, 2 unlocked Strategic Resources per turn. [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.

Upon completion, you will immediately gain two [ICON_Envoy] Envoys, and the cost of [ICON_Gold] to recruit City-State units is halved. [NEWLINE]If you are the overlord of a City-State, City-State units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength (including recruited units). [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.

+5 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor. Upon completion, you gain 2 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys and halve the cost of [ICON_Gold] to levy City-State units. [NEWLINE]If you are the overlord of a City-State, City-State units gain +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength (including levies). [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.

+1 [ICON_Movement] movement to all units, +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength to wounded units per turn, +5 [ICON_TECHBOOSTED] Eureka with cloaking and quantum communication technology. [NEWLINE] Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] title.

After completion, if you can obtain a Great Scientist, you will immediately gain an [ICON_GREATSCIENTIST] Great Scientist. All cities will gain +30% [ICON_Production] productivity when carrying out projects, and an additional +20% for space program projects. [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
Provides any 5 Great Works slots. +100% [ICON_Tourism] tourism performance provided by cultural relics and art Great Works in the city. [NEWLINE]Awards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
+1 to Spy and Spy Capacity. +20% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production when training spies. [NEWLINE]Increases the success rate of all espionage operations. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
+5 [ICON_Tourism] Tourism. Can only be built once in a city, even if the city has multiple neighborhoods. Building output is distributed to all neighborhoods in the city.
Amundsen-Scott Polar Research Station

Cities with Research Labs gain +10% [ICON_SCIENCE] Science and +10% [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production. If there are 5 Snow or Snow Hills tiles within 3 tiles of a city, and those tiles are owned by the player, these outputs are doubled. Must be built on Snow or Snow Hills tiles.
Improves external defense. Grants +1 influence point per turn. Grants 2 [ICON_TOURISM] tourism points after gaining the Protect the Earth civic. This city is not affected by the Battering Ram effect.
Only one can be built in a city, even if the city has multiple neighborhoods. Building output radiates to all neighborhoods in the city.

Areas required to build Tech Victory Projects. These include: {LOC_PROJECT_LAUNCH_EARTH_SATELLITE_NAME}, {LOC_PROJECT_LAUNCH_MOON_LANDING_NAME}, {LOC_PROJECT_LAUNCH_MARS_BASE_NAME}, and {LOC_PROJECT_LAUNCH_EXOPLANET_EXPEDITION_NAME}. Cannot be built on frozen soil or snow.

A district built on plains that connects two water tiles or connects a water tile to the city center. If a [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route passes through this district, it will receive multiple [ICON_Gold] gold from the destination district. Canals can go straight through tiles, or make 60-degree turns. Canals cannot be built in three directions, and must contain a full land tile on both sides of the waterway they are built on. Military Engineers can use 1 use to complete 30% of a canal's construction.

Districts built on floodplain tiles improve the quality of life along a river (but reduce output from floods by half). They prevent damage from flooding, and prevent [ICON_Food] food loss during droughts. Only 1 can be built per river's floodplain (counted as built if a civilization has built one), and the river must cross at least two sides of the dam tile. Military Engineers can use 1 use to complete 30% of the dam's construction progress.

A region draws water from a neighboring river, lake, oasis, or mountain, providing this city with fresh water. Cities without fresh water gain up to 6 [ICON_Housing] housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities. Conversely, cities with fresh water gain +2 [ICON_Housing] housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities if they are adjacent to a geothermal fissure. Prevents [ICON_Food] food loss during droughts. Must be built in a tile adjacent to the City Center. Military Engineers can use 1 use to complete 50% of the construction of an Aqueduct.

A Roman District that promotes urban development. Replaces Aqueduct, but is cheaper to build. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Draws water from a neighboring river, lake, oasis, or mountain to provide this city with Fresh Water. Cities that do not already have Fresh Water gain up to 6 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Cities that already have Fresh Water gain +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities if adjacent to a Geothermal Fissure. Baths provide an additional +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities in all cases. Prevents [ICON_Food] Food loss during droughts. Must be built in a tile adjacent to the City Center. Military Engineers can use 1 charge to complete 50% of a Bath's construction.

Provides up to 3 [ICON_Housing] Housing based on Charisma. Casts a Culture Bomb on an adjacent neutral cell and increases its Charisma by 1. [NEWLINE]Adds +1 [ICON_FOOD] Food to an adjacent unimproved Charming cell. +2 [ICON_FOOD] Food to an adjacent unimproved Awesome cell. [NEWLINE]Adds +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to an adjacent unimproved Charming cell after Poetry and Drama is unlocked. +2 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture to an adjacent unimproved Awesome cell. [NEWLINE]Adds +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith to an adjacent unimproved Charming cell after Theology is unlocked. +2 [ICON_Faith] Faith to an adjacent unimproved Awesome cell. [NEWLINE]Adds +1 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to an adjacent unimproved Charming cell after Mercantilism is unlocked. +2 [ICON_GOLD] Gold to an adjacent unimproved Awesome cell. [NEWLINE]Unlock "Natural History" to give +1 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to adjacent unimproved charming cells. +2 [ICON_SCIENCE] Science to adjacent unimproved stunning cells. [NEWLINE]Unlock "Protect the Earth" to give +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity to adjacent unimproved charming cells. +2 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Productivity to adjacent unimproved stunning cells.

+15% [ICON_Faith] Faith for this city. +5 [ICON_Strength] Strength for all monks and give 4 monks. Reduce the cost of buying monks in this city by 15%. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Must be built next to a holy area with a temple. The prerequisite for obtaining monks is that the player has founded a religion, or the player/city has a dominant religion.
+1 [ICON_Housing] Housing for all cities with 2 or more districts.
Allows alliances. [ICON_GOVERNOR] Governor provides +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenity upon taking office
Farms now produce +1 [ICON_Food] Food when adjacent to 2 Farm improvements. Camp improvements give +1 [ICON_Food] Food.
Camp Improvements +1 [ICON_Production] Production.
+2 [ICON_Gold] coins for camp improvements. +2 [ICON_TradeRoute] foreign trade routes
[ICON_CivicBoosted] Inspire provides an additional 10% civic progress.
The religious [ICON_Tourism] tourism benefits generated by other civilizations to you are halved.

Can recruit an additional spy. Allows two identical units to form a regiment or fleet. A new Casus Belli can now be used to justify wars: Colonial Wars. While at war, other civilizations' tourism benefits to you are halved.
Farms can be built on frozen land and deserts. +15% [ICON_PRODUCTION] production when building third-level buildings in unique regions. Terraced Farms +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] production.

Gain [ICON_TOURISM] Tourism from the Walls. Reveal the [ICON_RESOURCE_SHIPWRECK] Shipwreck Site, from which Archaeologists can excavate [ICON_GreatWork_Artifact] Artifacts. Reward 3 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys.

Rewards 3 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys. Allows construction of National Parks and purchase of Naturalists using [ICON_Faith] Faith. Allows builders to plant trees (planted forests). Gain +1 Appeal for trees in your territory that have never been removed (non-planted forests). Rainforests provide standard adjacency bonus instead of small adjacency bonus. +15% adjacency bonus to academy districts adjacent to reefs, and 15% more [ICON_Science] from buildings.
+2 [ICON_Housing] Housing for all cities with at least 3 separate districts.
+50% [ICON_Tourism] tourism performance throughout the empire.
City garrisons gain +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength.

[ICON_TradeRoute] Foreign Trade Routes +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold, +1 [ICON_CULTURE] Culture, +1 [ICON_Science] Science. +1 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Camp and Fishing Boat Improvements. +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold for Plantation Improvements.
Our cities gain +8 Loyalty, communities gain +8 [ICON_GOLD] gold, and +1 [ICON_Culture] culture per turn.
Entertainment Districts and Water Parks in cities and their buildings provide +3 [ICON_GOLD] gold coins, and cities with entertainment districts gain 8 loyalty.
Can be completed multiple times to increase the score of victory points. Each completion will reward 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title, 2 [ICON_Envoy] Envoys and 50 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor.
Guidance System Technology Enhancement
Military Units +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Mobility (Guidance System)

Damaged military units recover an additional 5 [ICON_DAMAGED] health points per turn (smart material)

Military units +1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement, +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength (Advanced AI)
+{1_num} from technology "Advanced Artificial Intelligence"
Air Force Base Strengthening
+5 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength for air units, +50% combat experience. (Air Force Base)
+{1_num} from "Air Force Base"
+{1_num} from static fortifications (tech boost)
Joint Combat Technology Enhancement
Doubled combat unit support and flanking bonuses
General Staff Strengthening
+1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] movement, +3 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength, injured units can recover an additional 5 health points per turn. (General Staff)
+{1_num} from "General Staff"
Siege Weapon Factory Enhancement
+20% combat experience for siege units. (Siege Weapon Factory)
Naval Base Reinforcement 1
+10% combat experience for naval units. (Naval Base)
Naval Base Enhancement 2
Damaged naval units in this city can recover an additional 5 health points each round. (Naval Base)
Go to the second dimension with Eel Girl to strengthen
+10 [ICON_STRENGTH] combat strength for naval units. (Let’s go to the second dimension with the eel girl!)
+{1_num} from "Let's go to the second dimension with the eel girl"
Internal combustion engine enhancement
+2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement for Civilian Units. (Internal Combustion Engine)
Logistics Policy Card Enhancement
+1 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement for allied units within 3 tiles of or adjacent to a territory. (Logistics)
Comprehensive attack logistics support policy card enhancement
Allied units in enemy territory can recover an additional 5 health points per turn. (Comprehensive Attack Logistics Support)
Mont Saint Michel fortification
+2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement for Apostles with the "Martyr" upgrade. (Mont Saint-Michel)

+10 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Monks. (Monk Creed)
+{1_num} from Monk's Creed

Monk +5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength. (Kotokuin)
+{1_num} from Gaodeyuan
Gunpowder and conquest
+5 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength for Janissaries, Barbary Corsairs, Dardanelles, Line Infantry, and Frigates. (Gunpowder and Conquest)
+{1_num} from Gunpowder and Conquest
The greatest sultan
When not in the [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age, units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength when in combat. (Suleiman the Magnificent)
+{1_num} from not being in the Golden Age. (Suleiman the Magnificent)

Vampire Castles grant +4 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength to all of your Military Units within 4 cells (non-stacking).

Unlocked during the Renaissance. [ICON_Capital] 1 Vampire unit will appear in the capital. Increases the maximum number of Vampire Castles you can build to 4. Business
Business Victory
Use your wealth to make the whole world surrender. Use gold to create eternal financial hegemony.
As we all agree, the world needs us to push it forward. The masses are blind and short-sighted. We will use our power to lead them to a better world.

To achieve the [COLOR:ResGoldLabelCS]Business[ENDCOLOR] victory, you must build the Federal Reserve, a tier 4 building in the Business Center. If a city has a Federal Reserve but does not own a Town Square, Palace, or Diplomatic District, and you are not at government level 4, the city will unlock 4 Business Victory projects. Complete all four projects and wait 3 [ICON_Turn] turns to achieve Business Victory. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]To counter an opponent who is about to achieve Business Victory, build a Central Bank, also a tier 4 building in the Business Center. Each Central Bank in the world increases the number of turns to win in the fifth stage of Business Victory by +2. You cannot have both a Federal Reserve and a Central Bank. Additionally, in the fifth stage, if the Federal Reserve is being pillaged, the countdown to win cannot be reduced. [NEWLINE][NEWLINE]After this victory is enabled, any civilization that has a 0 [ICON_Gold] Treasury and negative [ICON_Gold] gold per turn will revolt and become a Free City.

Workers can start improving Terraces. Mountain tiles provide +1 [ICON_PRODUCTION] Production, and +1 [ICON_Housing] Food for each Terrace Farm adjacent to them. Units adjacent to mountains gain +2 [ICON_MOVEMENT] Movement, +3 [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength. -80% cost to purchase Mountain tiles.

Cities adjacent to mountains gain +2 [ICON_AMENITIES] Amenities, +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Mountains gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold. Terraced Farms gain +1 [ICON_Food] Food, +1 [ICON_Production] Production. Unlocking the "Foreign Trade" civic grants Inca Road Improvements.

Sweden gains 100 [ICON_Favor] Diplomatic Favor (at standard speed) when recruiting Great People. +2 All Great People Points per turn when in the Golden Age. City construction zones in deserts, frozen soil, and snow are 25% faster, and an additional zone can be built. Melee units gain +1 [ICON_Movement] movement, +5 [ICON_Strength] combat strength, and heavy cavalry units can move after attacking. If Sweden enters the Industrial Age in the game, 3 special World Parliament competitions will be added. Sweden also has a wonderful bonus, but it can't be written here. For more information, please follow and consult the B station UP Slimy Eel Girl.
Swedish land, Swedish sea

When all slots are filled, buildings with 3 or more Great Work slots and wonders with 2 or more Great Work slots automatically gain a theme. The Queen's Library can be built in the city center. Buildings in the Town Square are 100% faster, and the Town Square and its buildings gain +2 [ICON_Science], +2 [ICON_Culture], and +2 [ICON_Faith]. Cities in frozen land and deserts gain +1 Charm.

Unique Swedish city center building. +2 extra Great People points of all types. Contains 8 slots for 2 [ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] books, [ICON_GreatWork_MUSIC] music, any type of [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Work of Art, and [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] relics. [NEWLINE]Rewards 1 [ICON_Governor] Governor title.
Roman Empire

All cities you create or capture start with a Trade Post. Cities automatically build a road to Rome if they are within the [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route of your [ICON_Capital]. +2 [ICON_Gold] for each [ICON_TradeRoute] trade route that passes through your city's Trade Post. 100% faster construction of Dams, Breakwaters, Recreation Districts, Harbors and Commercial Districts. 100% faster construction of Ancient and Classical Wonders.

Found, acquire or capture a city and grant all unlocked City Center buildings. Unlocks Pottery and Wheel technologies at the start of the game. Monuments grant +2 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +2 [ICON_Gold] Gold.
God's filial son

Construction of Holy Sites is 100% faster. Construction of Medieval and Renaissance Wonders is 100% faster. Heavy Cavalry units gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength, and Siege and Ranged units of the Renaissance and later eras gain +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.

Each Great Work in Eleanor's cities reduces the Loyalty of foreign cities within 9 tiles by 2 points per turn. After a city leaves another civilization due to losing Loyalty, if its Loyalty to Eleanor is the highest per turn, it will skip the Free City stage and join Eleanor's civilization. 100% speedup when constructing theaters and the buildings within them. +2 [ICON_GreatProphet] Great Prophet, [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer, [ICON_GreatMusician] Great Musician, [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist points per turn, doubled in the [ICON_GLORY_GOLDEN_AGE]. Holy Sites gain an adjacency bonus to theaters, and theaters gain +1 [ICON_GreatWriter] Great Writer and [ICON_GreatArtist] Great Artist point per turn. Your [ICON_GreatWork_Writing] and [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art gain +2 [ICON_Science] Technology, and your [ICON_GreatWork_Relic] and [ICON_GreatWork_Music] Great Works of Music gain +4 [ICON_Science] Technology.
[ICON_GreatWork_WRITING] Writings and [ICON_GreatWork_Landscape] Great Works of Art give +50% [ICON_Tourism] Tourism.
